category_system.description: Spanish profanity categorization considering regional variations and cultural context
category_system.methodology: Based on Spanish sociolinguistic research and regional usage patterns

general.name: Profanidad General
general.description: Common swear words and mild expletives without specific targeting
general.examples_note: Basic profanity used for emphasis or frustration

sexual.name: Contenido Sexual
sexual.description: Words related to sexual acts, anatomy, or sexually explicit content

subcategories.anatomy: Sexual body parts and references (verga, coño, culo)
subcategories.prostitution: Terms related to sex work (puta, prostituta)

slurs.name: Insultos y Términos Despectivos
slurs.description: Derogatory terms targeting specific groups or individuals
slurs.examples_note: Offensive terms for groups and individuals

subcategories.appearance: Physical appearance insults (feo, gordo usado as slurs)

racial.name: Insultos Raciales
racial.description: Racially charged language and ethnic slurs

religious.name: Profanidad Religiosa
religious.description: Blasphemous or sacrilegious language targeting religious beliefs

violence.name: Violencia y Agresión
violence.description: Words promoting or describing violence, threats, or aggressive behavior

subcategories.threats: Direct or implied threats of harm (te mato)
subcategories.weapons: References to weapons in threatening context
subcategories.death_wishes: Expressions wishing harm or death (que te mueras)

scatological.name: Escatológico
scatological.description: References to bodily waste and bathroom functions

subcategories.crude_anatomy: Crude references to body parts involved

body_parts.name: Partes del Cuerpo Inapropiadas
body_parts.description: Crude or inappropriate references to body parts
body_parts.examples_note: Anatomical terms used inappropriately or crudely

1.description: Generally acceptable in casual conversation but may be filtered in formal settings
1.cultural_notes: Often used in friendly context, especially in Spain

2.description: Inappropriate in most professional or public settings
2.cultural_notes: Context-dependent severity, varies by region and relationship

3.description: Highly offensive and inappropriate in most contexts
3.cultural_notes: Clearly offensive across all Spanish-speaking regions

4.description: Extremely offensive, potentially illegal, or causing significant harm
4.cultural_notes: Hate speech level, can have legal consequences in some countries

spain.tolerance_level: Higher for sexual profanity, lower for religious blasphemy

argentina.tolerance_level: High tolerance for creative insults in informal settings

gender_considerations.agreement_rules: Most Spanish profanity follows grammatical gender agreement
gender_considerations.severity_differences: Some terms more offensive when targeting women (puta vs puto)
gender_considerations.cultural_impact: Machismo culture affects severity of gender-specific terms
